meanings.definition: To carry out (a task) clumsily or incompetently.
meanings.sent1: He tends to bungle simple tasks.
meanings.sent2: Please don't bungle the presentation tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, he managed to bungle the recipe.
meanings.sent4: She always finds a way to bungle even the easiest of tasks.
meanings.sent5: The new employee's tendency to bungle assignments was becoming a concern.

meanings.definition: A mistake or error caused by clumsiness or incompetence.
meanings.sent1: The project was a bungle from start to finish.
meanings.sent2: She realized her error was a bungle that could have been avoided.
meanings.sent3: His bungle in the meeting caused everyone to chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The decision to cut corners turned out to be a costly bungle.
meanings.sent5: The bungle in the report led to a series of misunderstandings.
